text.p: These are the leading stories in the Malawi press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- The main opposition Malawi Congress Party (MCP) said on Sunday it would field first choice candidate Jabulani Manda who the Electoral Commission earlier barred from contesting in the postponed Blantyre City by-elections for not being a registered voter.

- A candidate for opposition Alliance for Democracy Evans Kapesi expected to contest in the Blantyre by-elections for November 19 and reported missing since last Wednesday resurfaced on Saturday saying he had gone into hiding after being tipped of an assassinaion attempt.

- An opposition People's Democratic Party contesting for the first time has filed an injunction to halt by-elections scheduled for Tuesday, November 19, at Machinga, more than 100km north east of Blantyre, in grounds of gross violation of the constitution and massive irregularities.

- Director for the government controlled radio Malawi Broadcasting Corporation Sam Gunde on Friday paraded the main opposition MCP candidate for the November 19, Blantyre by-elections, Edward Mlongoti, before journalists to announce his withdrawal from the race.
- Family members for MCP candidate Edward Mlongoti, who on Friday announced his withdrawal from the November 19 by-elections race, said he and his wife had gone missing.
- Minister for Natural Resources Mervin Moyo spent 50,000 Malawi kwacha ($3,000) 11 days ahead of schedule to attend a ministerial conference held in Argentina on November 13 and 14.
